general_advisory: Fairly widespread rain/thundershower is very likely over districts of Odisha during the week 1 (6th - 12th September, 2024) with isolated heavy rainfall.

advisory: Farmers are advised to spray of leaf extracts of Bael or Tulsi or Neem per litre of water for reducing the incidence of insects & diseases.
If leaf blast is observed, spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG (Nativo) for control.
Install Pheromone traps and light trap to monitor and control the population of pests.
Release egg parasitoid Trichogramma japonicum in stem borer endemic areas.
Apply plant hormone Planofix for improving seed cotton yield.
Apply total killer herbicide glyphosate or Glufosinate Ammonium for weed control.
To control leaf webber infestation, spray Profenophos 50% EC or Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% EC.
Monitor field regularly for pests and apply neem-based pesticide at initial stage of infestation.
Apply Urea at tasseling stage if water is insufficient.
Monitor field regularly for pests like stem borer and banded leaf and sheath blight.
Install yellow sticky trap to monitor sucking pests.
Spray Tebuconazole to control wilting.
Install Blue sticky trap to monitor thrips infestation.
Spray neem based pesticide for thrips control.
Now is a suitable time for raising tomato seedlings.
Choose suitable varieties like Utkal Kumari, Utkal Deepti, Utkal Raja, Utkal Pragyan, and Swarna Sampad.
Provide 1 kg of concentrate for every 2 kg of milk to dairy animals due to high moisture content in grasses.
Keep dry fodder and straw ready for sheep and goat in rainy season.
Ensure balanced concentrate feeding one month prior to kidding and lambing.
Clean poultry houses daily and change feed and water frequently.
Do not bring poultry birds or eggs from affected areas to home.
